text:
- Having highly-available
and resilient apps

is kind of an expectation
of customers these days.
No one wants to log into their app
or hop on a website and, you know,
get some 404 error or something else.
It's really important that, you know,
our teams know what the standards are

that they're building towards
and how to execute on those,
so that they can go ahead
and put out the best product available.
We started with a baseline

of the existing AWS
Well-Architected Framework.

We saw there's a lot of
good value in there already.

Good information on
building apps in the web
or in the cloud, really, you know,
and putting things out there.
So we went ahead and came
up with a solution using Step Functions,
Lambda, the Well-Architected Tool

and EventBridge to go ahead
and pull automation together
to help teams get in there and work.
So what this means for our internal teams

is that they really have
an easier time getting
to the information that they need
to properly execute on their jobs.

If we're building
applications the right way,

they're resilient
applications, they're reliable.

You don't have to worry
about unexpected downtime

or weird errors because
you didn't build something
the right way the first time,

then, it's just a better
experience for the users.

Like I said, we wanna put
out industry-leading products
at all times and making sure

that we're communicating
out the right standards

to our teams in a proactive
manner helps us do that.
